        unsafe { atomic_and(self.v.get(), val as u8, order) != 0 }

            

        

            

                1070
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1071
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1072
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Logical "nand" with a boolean value.

            

        

            

                1073
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1074
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Performs a logical "nand" operation on the current value and the argument `val`, and sets

            

        

            

                1075
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// the new value to the result.

            

        

            

                1076
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1077
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Returns the previous value.

            

        

            

                1078
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1079
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `fetch_nand` takes an [`Ordering`] argument which describes the memory ordering

            

        

            

                1080
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// of this operation. All ordering modes are possible. Note that using

            

        

            

                1081
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [`Acquire`] makes the store part of this operation [`Relaxed`], and

            

        

            

                1082
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// using [`Release`] makes the load part [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1083
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1084
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// **Note:** This method is only available on platforms that support atomic

            

        

            

                1085
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// operations on `u8`.

            

        

            

                1086
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1087
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1088
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1089
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1090
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicBool, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1091
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1092
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let foo = AtomicBool::new(true);

            

        

            

                1093
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.fetch_nand(false, Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1094
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.load(Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1095
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1096
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let foo = AtomicBool::new(true);

            

        

            

                1097
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.fetch_nand(true, Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1098
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.load(Ordering::SeqCst) as usize, 0);

            

        

            

                1099
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.load(Ordering::SeqCst), false);

            

        

            

                1100
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1101
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let foo = AtomicBool::new(false);

            

        

            

                1102
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.fetch_nand(false, Ordering::SeqCst), false);

            

        

            

                1103
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.load(Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1104
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1105
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1106
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "rust1", since = "1.0.0")]

            

        

            

                1107
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg(target_has_atomic = "8")]

            

        

            

                1108
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg_attr(miri, track_caller)] // even without panics, this helps for Miri backtraces

            

        

            

                1109
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn fetch_nand(&self, val: bool, order: Ordering) -> bool {

            

        

            

                1110
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // We can't use atomic_nand here because it can result in a bool with

            

        

            

                1111
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // an invalid value. This happens because the atomic operation is done

            

        

            

                1112
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // with an 8-bit integer internally, which would set the upper 7 bits.

            

        

            

                1113
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // So we just use fetch_xor or swap instead.

            

        

            

                1114
            

            

                
            

            

                
        if val {

            

        

            

                1115
            

            

                
            

            

                
            // !(x & true) == !x

            

        

            

                1116
            

            

                
            

            

                
            // We must invert the bool.

            

        

            

                1117
            

            

                
            

            

                
            self.fetch_xor(true, order)

            

        

            

                1118
            

            

                
            

            

                
        } else {

            

        

            

                1119
            

            

                
            

            

                
            // !(x & false) == true

            

        

            

                1120
            

            

                
            

            

                
            // We must set the bool to true.

            

        

            

                1121
            

            

                
            

            

                
            self.swap(true, order)

            

        

            

                1122
            

            

                
            

            

                
        }

            

        

            

                1123
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1124
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1125
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Logical "or" with a boolean value.

            

        

            

                1126
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1127
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Performs a logical "or" operation on the current value and the argument `val`, and sets the

            

        

            

                1128
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// new value to the result.

            

        

            

                1129
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1130
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Returns the previous value.

            

        

            

                1131
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1132
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `fetch_or` takes an [`Ordering`] argument which describes the memory ordering

            

        

            

                1133
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// of this operation. All ordering modes are possible. Note that using

            

        

            

                1134
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [`Acquire`] makes the store part of this operation [`Relaxed`], and

            

        

            

                1135
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// using [`Release`] makes the load part [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1136
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1137
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// **Note:** This method is only available on platforms that support atomic

            

        

            

                1138
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// operations on `u8`.

            

        

            

                1139
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1140
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1141
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1142
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1143
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicBool, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1144
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1145
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let foo = AtomicBool::new(true);

            

        

            

                1146
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.fetch_or(false, Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1147
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.load(Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1148
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1149
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let foo = AtomicBool::new(true);

            

        

            

                1150
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.fetch_or(true, Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1151
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.load(Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1152
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1153
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let foo = AtomicBool::new(false);

            

        

            

                1154
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.fetch_or(false, Ordering::SeqCst), false);

            

        

            

                1155
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.load(Ordering::SeqCst), false);

            

        

            

                1156
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1157
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1158
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "rust1", since = "1.0.0")]

            

        

            

                1159
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg(target_has_atomic = "8")]

            

        

            

                1160
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg_attr(miri, track_caller)] // even without panics, this helps for Miri backtraces

            

        

            

                1161
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn fetch_or(&self, val: bool, order: Ordering) -> bool {

            

        

            

                1162
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // SAFETY: data races are prevented by atomic intrinsics.

            

        

            

                1163
            

            

                
            

            

                
        unsafe { atomic_or(self.v.get(), val as u8, order) != 0 }

            

        

            

                1164
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1165
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1166
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Logical "xor" with a boolean value.

            

        

            

                1167
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1168
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Performs a logical "xor" operation on the current value and the argument `val`, and sets

            

        

            

                1169
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// the new value to the result.

            

        

            

                1170
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1171
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Returns the previous value.

            

        

            

                1172
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1173
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `fetch_xor` takes an [`Ordering`] argument which describes the memory ordering

            

        

            

                1174
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// of this operation. All ordering modes are possible. Note that using

            

        

            

                1175
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [`Acquire`] makes the store part of this operation [`Relaxed`], and

            

        

            

                1176
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// using [`Release`] makes the load part [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1177
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1178
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// **Note:** This method is only available on platforms that support atomic

            

        

            

                1179
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// operations on `u8`.

            

        

            

                1180
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1181
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1182
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1183
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1184
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicBool, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1185
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1186
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let foo = AtomicBool::new(true);

            

        

            

                1187
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.fetch_xor(false, Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1188
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.load(Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1189
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1190
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let foo = AtomicBool::new(true);

            

        

            

                1191
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.fetch_xor(true, Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1192
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.load(Ordering::SeqCst), false);

            

        

            

                1193
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1194
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let foo = AtomicBool::new(false);

            

        

            

                1195
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.fetch_xor(false, Ordering::SeqCst), false);

            

        

            

                1196
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.load(Ordering::SeqCst), false);

            

        

            

                1197
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1198
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1199
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "rust1", since = "1.0.0")]

            

        

            

                1200
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg(target_has_atomic = "8")]

            

        

            

                1201
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg_attr(miri, track_caller)] // even without panics, this helps for Miri backtraces

            

        

            

                1202
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn fetch_xor(&self, val: bool, order: Ordering) -> bool {

            

        

            

                1203
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // SAFETY: data races are prevented by atomic intrinsics.

            

        

            

                1204
            

            

                
            

            

                
        unsafe { atomic_xor(self.v.get(), val as u8, order) != 0 }

            

        

            

                1205
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1206
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1207
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Logical "not" with a boolean value.

            

        

            

                1208
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1209
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Performs a logical "not" operation on the current value, and sets

            

        

            

                1210
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// the new value to the result.

            

        

            

                1211
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1212
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Returns the previous value.

            

        

            

                1213
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1214
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `fetch_not` takes an [`Ordering`] argument which describes the memory ordering

            

        

            

                1215
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// of this operation. All ordering modes are possible. Note that using

            

        

            

                1216
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [`Acquire`] makes the store part of this operation [`Relaxed`], and

            

        

            

                1217
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// using [`Release`] makes the load part [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1218
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1219
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// **Note:** This method is only available on platforms that support atomic

            

        

            

                1220
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// operations on `u8`.

            

        

            

                1221
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1222
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1223
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1224
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1225
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicBool, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1226
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1227
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let foo = AtomicBool::new(true);

            

        

            

                1228
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.fetch_not(Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1229
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.load(Ordering::SeqCst), false);

            

        

            

                1230
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1231
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let foo = AtomicBool::new(false);

            

        

            

                1232
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.fetch_not(Ordering::SeqCst), false);

            

        

            

                1233
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(foo.load(Ordering::SeqCst), true);

            

        

            

                1234
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1235
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1236
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "atomic_bool_fetch_not", since = "1.81.0")]

            

        

            

                1237
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg(target_has_atomic = "8")]

            

        

            

                1238
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg_attr(miri, track_caller)] // even without panics, this helps for Miri backtraces

            

        

            

                1239
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn fetch_not(&self, order: Ordering) -> bool {

            

        

            

                1240
            

            

                
            

            

                
        self.fetch_xor(true, order)

            

        

            

                1241
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1242
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1243
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Returns a mutable pointer to the underlying [`bool`].

            

        

            

                1244
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1245
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Doing non-atomic reads and writes on the resulting boolean can be a data race.

            

        

            

                1246
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// This method is mostly useful for FFI, where the function signature may use

            

        

            

                1247
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `*mut bool` instead of `&AtomicBool`.

            

        

            

                1248
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1249
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Returning an `*mut` pointer from a shared reference to this atomic is safe because the

            

        

            

                1250
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// atomic types work with interior mutability. All modifications of an atomic change the value

            

        

            

                1251
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// through a shared reference, and can do so safely as long as they use atomic operations. Any

            

        

            

                1252
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use of the returned raw pointer requires an `unsafe` block and still has to uphold the same

            

        

            

                1253
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// restriction: operations on it must be atomic.

            

        

            

                1254
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1255
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1256
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1257
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```ignore (extern-declaration)

            

        

            

                1258
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # fn main() {

            

        

            

                1259
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::AtomicBool;

            

        

            

                1260
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1261
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// extern "C" {

            

        

            

                1262
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     fn my_atomic_op(arg: *mut bool);

            

        

            

                1263
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// }

            

        

            

                1264
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1265
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let mut atomic = AtomicBool::new(true);

            

        

            

                1266
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// unsafe {

            

        

            

                1267
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     my_atomic_op(atomic.as_ptr());

            

        

            

                1268
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// }

            

        

            

                1269
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # }

            

        

            

                1270
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1271
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1272
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "atomic_as_ptr", since = "1.70.0")]

            

        

            

                1273
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[rustc_const_stable(feature = "atomic_as_ptr", since = "1.70.0")]

            

        

            

                1274
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[rustc_never_returns_null_ptr]

            

        

            

                1275
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub const fn as_ptr(&self) -> *mut bool {

            

        

            

                1276
            

            

                
            

            

                
        self.v.get().cast()

            

        

            

                1277
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1278
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1279
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Fetches the value, and applies a function to it that returns an optional

            

        

            

                1280
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// new value. Returns a `Result` of `Ok(previous_value)` if the function

            

        

            

                1281
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// returned `Some(_)`, else `Err(previous_value)`.

            

        

            

                1282
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1283
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Note: This may call the function multiple times if the value has been

            

        

            

                1284
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// changed from other threads in the meantime, as long as the function

            

        

            

                1285
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// returns `Some(_)`, but the function will have been applied only once to

            

        

            

                1286
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// the stored value.

            

        

            

                1287
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1288
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `fetch_update` takes two [`Ordering`] arguments to describe the memory

            

        

            

                1289
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ordering of this operation. The first describes the required ordering for

            

        

            

                1290
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// when the operation finally succeeds while the second describes the

            

        

            

                1291
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// required ordering for loads. These correspond to the success and failure

            

        

            

                1292
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// orderings of [`AtomicBool::compare_exchange`] respectively.

            

        

            

                1293
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1294
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Using [`Acquire`] as success ordering makes the store part of this

            

        

            

                1295
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// operation [`Relaxed`], and using [`Release`] makes the final successful

            

        

            

                1296
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// load [`Relaxed`]. The (failed) load ordering can only be [`SeqCst`],

            

        

            

                1297
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [`Acquire`] or [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1298
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1299
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// **Note:** This method is only available on platforms that support atomic

            

        

            

                1300
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// operations on `u8`.

            

        

            

                1301
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1302
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Considerations

            

        

            

                1303
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1304
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// This method is not magic; it is not provided by the hardware.

            

        

            

                1305
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// It is implemented in terms of [`AtomicBool::compare_exchange_weak`], and suffers from the same drawbacks.

            

        

            

                1306
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// In particular, this method will not circumvent the [ABA Problem].

            

        

            

                1307
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1308
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [ABA Problem]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ABA_problem

            

        

            

                1309
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1310
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1311
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1312
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```rust

            

        

            

                1313
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicBool, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1314
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1315
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let x = AtomicBool::new(false);

            

        

            

                1316
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(x.fetch_update(Ordering::SeqCst, Ordering::SeqCst, |_| None), Err(false));

            

        

            

                1317
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(x.fetch_update(Ordering::SeqCst, Ordering::SeqCst, |x| Some(!x)), Ok(false));

            

        

            

                1318
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(x.fetch_update(Ordering::SeqCst, Ordering::SeqCst, |x| Some(!x)), Ok(true));

            

        

            

                1319
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(x.load(Ordering::SeqCst), false);

            

        

            

                1320
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1321
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1322
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "atomic_fetch_update", since = "1.53.0")]

            

        

            

                1323
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg(target_has_atomic = "8")]

            

        

            

                1324
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg_attr(miri, track_caller)] // even without panics, this helps for Miri backtraces

            

        

            

                1325
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn fetch_update<F>(

            

        

            

                1326
            

            

                
            

            

                
        &self,

            

        

            

                1327
            

            

                
            

            

                
        set_order: Ordering,

            

        

            

                1328
            

            

                
            

            

                
        fetch_order: Ordering,

            

        

            

                1329
            

            

                
            

            

                
        mut f: F,

            

        

            

                1330
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ) -> Result<bool, bool>

            

        

            

                1331
            

            

                
            

            

                
    where

            

        

            

                1332
            

            

                
            

            

                
        F: FnMut(bool) -> Option<bool>,

            

        

            

                1333
            

            

                
            

            

                
    {

            

        

            

                1334
            

            

                
            

            

                
        let mut prev = self.load(fetch_order);

            

        

            

                1335
            

            

                
            

            

                
        while let Some(next) = f(prev) {

            

        

            

                1336
            

            

                
            

            

                
            match self.compare_exchange_weak(prev, next, set_order, fetch_order) {

            

        

            

                1337
            

            

                
            

            

                
                x @ Ok(_) => return x,

            

        

            

                1338
            

            

                
            

            

                
                Err(next_prev) => prev = next_prev,

            

        

            

                1339
            

            

                
            

            

                
            }

            

        

            

                1340
            

            

                
            

            

                
        }

            

        

            

                1341
            

            

                
            

            

                
        Err(prev)

            

        

            

                1342
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1343
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1344
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Fetches the value, and applies a function to it that returns an optional

            

        

            

                1345
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// new value. Returns a `Result` of `Ok(previous_value)` if the function

            

        

            

                1346
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// returned `Some(_)`, else `Err(previous_value)`.

            

        

            

                1347
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1348
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// See also: [`update`](`AtomicBool::update`).

            

        

            

                1349
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1350
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Note: This may call the function multiple times if the value has been

            

        

            

                1351
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// changed from other threads in the meantime, as long as the function

            

        

            

                1352
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// returns `Some(_)`, but the function will have been applied only once to

            

        

            

                1353
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// the stored value.

            

        

            

                1354
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1355
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `try_update` takes two [`Ordering`] arguments to describe the memory

            

        

            

                1356
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ordering of this operation. The first describes the required ordering for

            

        

            

                1357
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// when the operation finally succeeds while the second describes the

            

        

            

                1358
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// required ordering for loads. These correspond to the success and failure

            

        

            

                1359
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// orderings of [`AtomicBool::compare_exchange`] respectively.

            

        

            

                1360
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1361
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Using [`Acquire`] as success ordering makes the store part of this

            

        

            

                1362
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// operation [`Relaxed`], and using [`Release`] makes the final successful

            

        

            

                1363
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// load [`Relaxed`]. The (failed) load ordering can only be [`SeqCst`],

            

        

            

                1364
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [`Acquire`] or [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1365
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1366
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// **Note:** This method is only available on platforms that support atomic

            

        

            

                1367
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// operations on `u8`.

            

        

            

                1368
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1369
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Considerations

            

        

            

                1370
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1371
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// This method is not magic; it is not provided by the hardware.

            

        

            

                1372
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// It is implemented in terms of [`AtomicBool::compare_exchange_weak`], and suffers from the same drawbacks.

            

        

            

                1373
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// In particular, this method will not circumvent the [ABA Problem].

            

        

            

                1374
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1375
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [ABA Problem]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ABA_problem

            

        

            

                1376
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1377
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1378
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1379
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```rust

            

        

            

                1380
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// #![feature(atomic_try_update)]

            

        

            

                1381
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicBool, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1382
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1383
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let x = AtomicBool::new(false);

            

        

            

                1384
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(x.try_update(Ordering::SeqCst, Ordering::SeqCst, |_| None), Err(false));

            

        

            

                1385
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(x.try_update(Ordering::SeqCst, Ordering::SeqCst, |x| Some(!x)), Ok(false));

            

        

            

                1386
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(x.try_update(Ordering::SeqCst, Ordering::SeqCst, |x| Some(!x)), Ok(true));

            

        

            

                1387
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(x.load(Ordering::SeqCst), false);

            

        

            

                1388
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1389
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1390
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[unstable(feature = "atomic_try_update", issue = "135894")]

            

        

            

                1391
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg(target_has_atomic = "8")]

            

        

            

                1392
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg_attr(miri, track_caller)] // even without panics, this helps for Miri backtraces

            

        

            

                1393
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn try_update(

            

        

            

                1394
            

            

                
            

            

                
        &self,

            

        

            

                1395
            

            

                
            

            

                
        set_order: Ordering,

            

        

            

                1396
            

            

                
            

            

                
        fetch_order: Ordering,

            

        

            

                1397
            

            

                
            

            

                
        f: impl FnMut(bool) -> Option<bool>,

            

        

            

                1398
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ) -> Result<bool, bool> {

            

        

            

                1399
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // FIXME(atomic_try_update): this is currently an unstable alias to `fetch_update`;

            

        

            

                1400
            

            

                
            

            

                
        //      when stabilizing, turn `fetch_update` into a deprecated alias to `try_update`.

            

        

            

                1401
            

            

                
            

            

                
        self.fetch_update(set_order, fetch_order, f)

            

        

            

                1402
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1403
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1404
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Fetches the value, applies a function to it that it return a new value.

            

        

            

                1405
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// The new value is stored and the old value is returned.

            

        

            

                1406
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1407
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// See also: [`try_update`](`AtomicBool::try_update`).

            

        

            

                1408
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1409
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Note: This may call the function multiple times if the value has been changed from other threads in

            

        

            

                1410
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// the meantime, but the function will have been applied only once to the stored value.

            

        

            

                1411
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1412
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `update` takes two [`Ordering`] arguments to describe the memory

            

        

            

                1413
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ordering of this operation. The first describes the required ordering for

            

        

            

                1414
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// when the operation finally succeeds while the second describes the

            

        

            

                1415
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// required ordering for loads. These correspond to the success and failure

            

        

            

                1416
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// orderings of [`AtomicBool::compare_exchange`] respectively.

            

        

            

                1417
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1418
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Using [`Acquire`] as success ordering makes the store part

            

        

            

                1419
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// of this operation [`Relaxed`], and using [`Release`] makes the final successful load

            

        

            

                1420
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [`Relaxed`]. The (failed) load ordering can only be [`SeqCst`], [`Acquire`] or [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1421
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1422
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// **Note:** This method is only available on platforms that support atomic operations on `u8`.

            

        

            

                1423
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1424
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Considerations

            

        

            

                1425
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1426
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// This method is not magic; it is not provided by the hardware.

            

        

            

                1427
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// It is implemented in terms of [`AtomicBool::compare_exchange_weak`], and suffers from the same drawbacks.

            

        

            

                1428
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// In particular, this method will not circumvent the [ABA Problem].

            

        

            

                1429
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1430
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [ABA Problem]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ABA_problem

            

        

            

                1431
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1432
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1433
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1434
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```rust

            

        

            

                1435
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// #![feature(atomic_try_update)]

            

        

            

                1436
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1437
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicBool, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1438
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1439
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let x = AtomicBool::new(false);

            

        

            

                1440
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(x.update(Ordering::SeqCst, Ordering::SeqCst, |x| !x), false);

            

        

            

                1441
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(x.update(Ordering::SeqCst, Ordering::SeqCst, |x| !x), true);

            

        

            

                1442
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(x.load(Ordering::SeqCst), false);

            

        

            

                1443
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1444
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1445
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[unstable(feature = "atomic_try_update", issue = "135894")]

            

        

            

                1446
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg(target_has_atomic = "8")]

            

        

            

                1447
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg_attr(miri, track_caller)] // even without panics, this helps for Miri backtraces

            

        

            

                1448
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn update(

            

        

            

                1449
            

            

                
            

            

                
        &self,

            

        

            

                1450
            

            

                
            

            

                
        set_order: Ordering,

            

        

            

                1451
            

            

                
            

            

                
        fetch_order: Ordering,

            

        

            

                1452
            

            

                
            

            

                
        mut f: impl FnMut(bool) -> bool,

            

        

            

                1453
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ) -> bool {

            

        

            

                1454
            

            

                
            

            

                
        let mut prev = self.load(fetch_order);

            

        

            

                1455
            

            

                
            

            

                
        loop {

            

        

            

                1456
            

            

                
            

            

                
            match self.compare_exchange_weak(prev, f(prev), set_order, fetch_order) {

            

        

            

                1457
            

            

                
            

            

                
                Ok(x) => break x,

            

        

            

                1458
            

            

                
            

            

                
                Err(next_prev) => prev = next_prev,

            

        

            

                1459
            

            

                
            

            

                
            }

            

        

            

                1460
            

            

                
            

            

                
        }

            

        

            

                1461
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1462
            

            

                
            

            

                
}

            

        

            

                1463
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1464
            

            

                
            

            

                
#[cfg(target_has_atomic_load_store = "ptr")]

            

        

            

                1465
            

            

                
            

            

                
#[cfg(not(feature = "ferrocene_certified"))]

            

        

            

                1466
            

            

                
            

            

                
impl<T> AtomicPtr<T> {

            

        

            

                1467
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Creates a new `AtomicPtr`.

            

        

            

                1468
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1469
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1470
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1471
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1472
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::AtomicPtr;

            

        

            

                1473
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1474
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let ptr = &mut 5;

            

        

            

                1475
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let atomic_ptr = AtomicPtr::new(ptr);

            

        

            

                1476
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1477
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1478
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "rust1", since = "1.0.0")]

            

        

            

                1479
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[rustc_const_stable(feature = "const_atomic_new", since = "1.24.0")]

            

        

            

                1480
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub const fn new(p: *mut T) -> AtomicPtr<T> {

            

        

            

                1481
            

            

                
            

            

                
        AtomicPtr { p: UnsafeCell::new(p) }

            

        

            

                1482
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1483
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1484
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Creates a new `AtomicPtr` from a pointer.

            

        

            

                1485
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1486
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples
