                1487
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1488
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1489
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{self, AtomicPtr};

            

        

            

                1490
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1491
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// // Get a pointer to an allocated value

            

        

            

                1492
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let ptr: *mut *mut u8 = Box::into_raw(Box::new(std::ptr::null_mut()));

            

        

            

                1493
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1494
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert!(ptr.cast::<AtomicPtr<u8>>().is_aligned());

            

        

            

                1495
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1496
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// {

            

        

            

                1497
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     // Create an atomic view of the allocated value

            

        

            

                1498
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     let atomic = unsafe { AtomicPtr::from_ptr(ptr) };

            

        

            

                1499
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1500
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     // Use `atomic` for atomic operations, possibly share it with other threads

            

        

            

                1501
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     atomic.store(std::ptr::NonNull::dangling().as_ptr(), atomic::Ordering::Relaxed);

            

        

            

                1502
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// }

            

        

            

                1503
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1504
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// // It's ok to non-atomically access the value behind `ptr`,

            

        

            

                1505
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// // since the reference to the atomic ended its lifetime in the block above

            

        

            

                1506
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert!(!unsafe { *ptr }.is_null());

            

        

            

                1507
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1508
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// // Deallocate the value

            

        

            

                1509
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// unsafe { drop(Box::from_raw(ptr)) }

            

        

            

                1510
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1511
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1512
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Safety

            

        

            

                1513
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1514
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// * `ptr` must be aligned to `align_of::<AtomicPtr<T>>()` (note that on some platforms this

            

        

            

                1515
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///   can be bigger than `align_of::<*mut T>()`).

            

        

            

                1516
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// * `ptr` must be [valid] for both reads and writes for the whole lifetime `'a`.

            

        

            

                1517
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// * You must adhere to the [Memory model for atomic accesses]. In particular, it is not

            

        

            

                1518
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///   allowed to mix atomic and non-atomic accesses, or atomic accesses of different sizes,

            

        

            

                1519
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///   without synchronization.

            

        

            

                1520
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1521
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [valid]: crate::ptr#safety

            

        

            

                1522
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [Memory model for atomic accesses]: self#memory-model-for-atomic-accesses

            

        

            

                1523
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1524
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "atomic_from_ptr", since = "1.75.0")]

            

        

            

                1525
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[rustc_const_stable(feature = "const_atomic_from_ptr", since = "1.84.0")]

            

        

            

                1526
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub const unsafe fn from_ptr<'a>(ptr: *mut *mut T) -> &'a AtomicPtr<T> {

            

        

            

                1527
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // SAFETY: guaranteed by the caller

            

        

            

                1528
            

            

                
            

            

                
        unsafe { &*ptr.cast() }

            

        

            

                1529
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1530
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1531
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Returns a mutable reference to the underlying pointer.

            

        

            

                1532
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1533
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// This is safe because the mutable reference guarantees that no other threads are

            

        

            

                1534
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// concurrently accessing the atomic data.

            

        

            

                1535
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1536
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1537
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1538
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1539
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicPtr, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1540
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1541
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let mut data = 10;

            

        

            

                1542
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let mut atomic_ptr = AtomicPtr::new(&mut data);

            

        

            

                1543
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let mut other_data = 5;

            

        

            

                1544
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// *atomic_ptr.get_mut() = &mut other_data;

            

        

            

                1545
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(unsafe { *atomic_ptr.load(Ordering::SeqCst) }, 5);

            

        

            

                1546
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1547
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1548
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "atomic_access", since = "1.15.0")]

            

        

            

                1549
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn get_mut(&mut self) -> &mut *mut T {

            

        

            

                1550
            

            

                
            

            

                
        self.p.get_mut()

            

        

            

                1551
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1552
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1553
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Gets atomic access to a pointer.

            

        

            

                1554
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1555
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1556
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1557
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1558
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// #![feature(atomic_from_mut)]

            

        

            

                1559
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicPtr, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1560
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1561
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let mut data = 123;

            

        

            

                1562
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let mut some_ptr = &mut data as *mut i32;

            

        

            

                1563
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let a = AtomicPtr::from_mut(&mut some_ptr);

            

        

            

                1564
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let mut other_data = 456;

            

        

            

                1565
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// a.store(&mut other_data, Ordering::Relaxed);

            

        

            

                1566
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(unsafe { *some_ptr }, 456);

            

        

            

                1567
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1568
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1569
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg(target_has_atomic_equal_alignment = "ptr")]

            

        

            

                1570
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[unstable(feature = "atomic_from_mut", issue = "76314")]

            

        

            

                1571
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn from_mut(v: &mut *mut T) -> &mut Self {

            

        

            

                1572
            

            

                
            

            

                
        let [] = [(); align_of::<AtomicPtr<()>>() - align_of::<*mut ()>()];

            

        

            

                1573
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // SAFETY:

            

        

            

                1574
            

            

                
            

            

                
        //  - the mutable reference guarantees unique ownership.

            

        

            

                1575
            

            

                
            

            

                
        //  - the alignment of `*mut T` and `Self` is the same on all platforms

            

        

            

                1576
            

            

                
            

            

                
        //    supported by rust, as verified above.

            

        

            

                1577
            

            

                
            

            

                
        unsafe { &mut *(v as *mut *mut T as *mut Self) }

            

        

            

                1578
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1579
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1580
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Gets non-atomic access to a `&mut [AtomicPtr]` slice.

            

        

            

                1581
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1582
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// This is safe because the mutable reference guarantees that no other threads are

            

        

            

                1583
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// concurrently accessing the atomic data.

            

        

            

                1584
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1585
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1586
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1587
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1588
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// #![feature(atomic_from_mut)]

            

        

            

                1589
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::ptr::null_mut;

            

        

            

                1590
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicPtr, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1591
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1592
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let mut some_ptrs = [const { AtomicPtr::new(null_mut::<String>()) }; 10];

            

        

            

                1593
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1594
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let view: &mut [*mut String] = AtomicPtr::get_mut_slice(&mut some_ptrs);

            

        

            

                1595
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(view, [null_mut::<String>(); 10]);

            

        

            

                1596
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// view

            

        

            

                1597
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     .iter_mut()

            

        

            

                1598
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     .enumerate()

            

        

            

                1599
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     .for_each(|(i, ptr)| *ptr = Box::into_raw(Box::new(format!("iteration#{i}"))));

            

        

            

                1600
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1601
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// std::thread::scope(|s| {

            

        

            

                1602
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     for ptr in &some_ptrs {

            

        

            

                1603
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///         s.spawn(move || {

            

        

            

                1604
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///             let ptr = ptr.load(Ordering::Relaxed);

            

        

            

                1605
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///             assert!(!ptr.is_null());

            

        

            

                1606
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1607
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///             let name = unsafe { Box::from_raw(ptr) };

            

        

            

                1608
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///             println!("Hello, {name}!");

            

        

            

                1609
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///         });

            

        

            

                1610
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     }

            

        

            

                1611
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// });

            

        

            

                1612
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1613
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1614
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[unstable(feature = "atomic_from_mut", issue = "76314")]

            

        

            

                1615
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn get_mut_slice(this: &mut [Self]) -> &mut [*mut T] {

            

        

            

                1616
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // SAFETY: the mutable reference guarantees unique ownership.

            

        

            

                1617
            

            

                
            

            

                
        unsafe { &mut *(this as *mut [Self] as *mut [*mut T]) }

            

        

            

                1618
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1619
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1620
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Gets atomic access to a slice of pointers.

            

        

            

                1621
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1622
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1623
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1624
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1625
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// #![feature(atomic_from_mut)]

            

        

            

                1626
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::ptr::null_mut;

            

        

            

                1627
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicPtr, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1628
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1629
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let mut some_ptrs = [null_mut::<String>(); 10];

            

        

            

                1630
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let a = &*AtomicPtr::from_mut_slice(&mut some_ptrs);

            

        

            

                1631
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// std::thread::scope(|s| {

            

        

            

                1632
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     for i in 0..a.len() {

            

        

            

                1633
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///         s.spawn(move || {

            

        

            

                1634
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///             let name = Box::new(format!("thread{i}"));

            

        

            

                1635
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///             a[i].store(Box::into_raw(name), Ordering::Relaxed);

            

        

            

                1636
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///         });

            

        

            

                1637
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     }

            

        

            

                1638
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// });

            

        

            

                1639
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// for p in some_ptrs {

            

        

            

                1640
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     assert!(!p.is_null());

            

        

            

                1641
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     let name = unsafe { Box::from_raw(p) };

            

        

            

                1642
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     println!("Hello, {name}!");

            

        

            

                1643
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// }

            

        

            

                1644
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1645
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1646
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg(target_has_atomic_equal_alignment = "ptr")]

            

        

            

                1647
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[unstable(feature = "atomic_from_mut", issue = "76314")]

            

        

            

                1648
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn from_mut_slice(v: &mut [*mut T]) -> &mut [Self] {

            

        

            

                1649
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // SAFETY:

            

        

            

                1650
            

            

                
            

            

                
        //  - the mutable reference guarantees unique ownership.

            

        

            

                1651
            

            

                
            

            

                
        //  - the alignment of `*mut T` and `Self` is the same on all platforms

            

        

            

                1652
            

            

                
            

            

                
        //    supported by rust, as verified above.

            

        

            

                1653
            

            

                
            

            

                
        unsafe { &mut *(v as *mut [*mut T] as *mut [Self]) }

            

        

            

                1654
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1655
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1656
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Consumes the atomic and returns the contained value.

            

        

            

                1657
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1658
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// This is safe because passing `self` by value guarantees that no other threads are

            

        

            

                1659
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// concurrently accessing the atomic data.

            

        

            

                1660
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1661
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1662
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1663
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1664
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::AtomicPtr;

            

        

            

                1665
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1666
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let mut data = 5;

            

        

            

                1667
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let atomic_ptr = AtomicPtr::new(&mut data);

            

        

            

                1668
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// assert_eq!(unsafe { *atomic_ptr.into_inner() }, 5);

            

        

            

                1669
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1670
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1671
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "atomic_access", since = "1.15.0")]

            

        

            

                1672
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[rustc_const_stable(feature = "const_atomic_into_inner", since = "1.79.0")]

            

        

            

                1673
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub const fn into_inner(self) -> *mut T {

            

        

            

                1674
            

            

                
            

            

                
        self.p.into_inner()

            

        

            

                1675
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1676
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1677
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Loads a value from the pointer.

            

        

            

                1678
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1679
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `load` takes an [`Ordering`] argument which describes the memory ordering

            

        

            

                1680
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// of this operation. Possible values are [`SeqCst`], [`Acquire`] and [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1681
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1682
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Panics

            

        

            

                1683
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1684
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Panics if `order` is [`Release`] or [`AcqRel`].

            

        

            

                1685
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1686
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1687
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1688
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1689
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicPtr, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1690
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1691
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let ptr = &mut 5;

            

        

            

                1692
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let some_ptr = AtomicPtr::new(ptr);

            

        

            

                1693
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1694
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let value = some_ptr.load(Ordering::Relaxed);

            

        

            

                1695
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1696
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1697
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "rust1", since = "1.0.0")]

            

        

            

                1698
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg_attr(miri, track_caller)] // even without panics, this helps for Miri backtraces

            

        

            

                1699
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn load(&self, order: Ordering) -> *mut T {

            

        

            

                1700
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // SAFETY: data races are prevented by atomic intrinsics.

            

        

            

                1701
            

            

                
            

            

                
        unsafe { atomic_load(self.p.get(), order) }

            

        

            

                1702
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1703
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1704
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Stores a value into the pointer.

            

        

            

                1705
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1706
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `store` takes an [`Ordering`] argument which describes the memory ordering

            

        

            

                1707
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// of this operation. Possible values are [`SeqCst`], [`Release`] and [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1708
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1709
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Panics

            

        

            

                1710
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1711
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Panics if `order` is [`Acquire`] or [`AcqRel`].

            

        

            

                1712
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1713
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1714
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1715
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1716
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicPtr, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1717
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1718
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let ptr = &mut 5;

            

        

            

                1719
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let some_ptr = AtomicPtr::new(ptr);

            

        

            

                1720
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1721
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let other_ptr = &mut 10;

            

        

            

                1722
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1723
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// some_ptr.store(other_ptr, Ordering::Relaxed);

            

        

            

                1724
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1725
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1726
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "rust1", since = "1.0.0")]

            

        

            

                1727
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg_attr(miri, track_caller)] // even without panics, this helps for Miri backtraces

            

        

            

                1728
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn store(&self, ptr: *mut T, order: Ordering) {

            

        

            

                1729
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // SAFETY: data races are prevented by atomic intrinsics.

            

        

            

                1730
            

            

                
            

            

                
        unsafe {

            

        

            

                1731
            

            

                
            

            

                
            atomic_store(self.p.get(), ptr, order);

            

        

            

                1732
            

            

                
            

            

                
        }

            

        

            

                1733
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1734
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1735
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Stores a value into the pointer, returning the previous value.

            

        

            

                1736
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1737
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `swap` takes an [`Ordering`] argument which describes the memory ordering

            

        

            

                1738
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// of this operation. All ordering modes are possible. Note that using

            

        

            

                1739
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [`Acquire`] makes the store part of this operation [`Relaxed`], and

            

        

            

                1740
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// using [`Release`] makes the load part [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1741
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1742
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// **Note:** This method is only available on platforms that support atomic

            

        

            

                1743
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// operations on pointers.

            

        

            

                1744
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1745
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1746
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1747
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1748
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicPtr, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1749
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1750
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let ptr = &mut 5;

            

        

            

                1751
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let some_ptr = AtomicPtr::new(ptr);

            

        

            

                1752
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1753
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let other_ptr = &mut 10;

            

        

            

                1754
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1755
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let value = some_ptr.swap(other_ptr, Ordering::Relaxed);

            

        

            

                1756
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1757
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1758
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "rust1", since = "1.0.0")]

            

        

            

                1759
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg(target_has_atomic = "ptr")]

            

        

            

                1760
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg_attr(miri, track_caller)] // even without panics, this helps for Miri backtraces

            

        

            

                1761
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn swap(&self, ptr: *mut T, order: Ordering) -> *mut T {

            

        

            

                1762
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // SAFETY: data races are prevented by atomic intrinsics.

            

        

            

                1763
            

            

                
            

            

                
        unsafe { atomic_swap(self.p.get(), ptr, order) }

            

        

            

                1764
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1765
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1766
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Stores a value into the pointer if the current value is the same as the `current` value.

            

        

            

                1767
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1768
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// The return value is always the previous value. If it is equal to `current`, then the value

            

        

            

                1769
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// was updated.

            

        

            

                1770
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1771
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `compare_and_swap` also takes an [`Ordering`] argument which describes the memory

            

        

            

                1772
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ordering of this operation. Notice that even when using [`AcqRel`], the operation

            

        

            

                1773
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// might fail and hence just perform an `Acquire` load, but not have `Release` semantics.

            

        

            

                1774
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Using [`Acquire`] makes the store part of this operation [`Relaxed`] if it

            

        

            

                1775
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// happens, and using [`Release`] makes the load part [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1776
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1777
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// **Note:** This method is only available on platforms that support atomic

            

        

            

                1778
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// operations on pointers.

            

        

            

                1779
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1780
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Migrating to `compare_exchange` and `compare_exchange_weak`

            

        

            

                1781
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1782
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `compare_and_swap` is equivalent to `compare_exchange` with the following mapping for

            

        

            

                1783
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// memory orderings:

            

        

            

                1784
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1785
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Original | Success | Failure

            

        

            

                1786
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// -------- | ------- | -------

            

        

            

                1787
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Relaxed  | Relaxed | Relaxed

            

        

            

                1788
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Acquire  | Acquire | Acquire

            

        

            

                1789
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Release  | Release | Relaxed

            

        

            

                1790
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// AcqRel   | AcqRel  | Acquire

            

        

            

                1791
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// SeqCst   | SeqCst  | SeqCst

            

        

            

                1792
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1793
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `compare_and_swap` and `compare_exchange` also differ in their return type. You can use

            

        

            

                1794
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `compare_exchange(...).unwrap_or_else(|x| x)` to recover the behavior of `compare_and_swap`,

            

        

            

                1795
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// but in most cases it is more idiomatic to check whether the return value is `Ok` or `Err`

            

        

            

                1796
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// rather than to infer success vs failure based on the value that was read.

            

        

            

                1797
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1798
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// During migration, consider whether it makes sense to use `compare_exchange_weak` instead.

            

        

            

                1799
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `compare_exchange_weak` is allowed to fail spuriously even when the comparison succeeds,

            

        

            

                1800
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// which allows the compiler to generate better assembly code when the compare and swap

            

        

            

                1801
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// is used in a loop.

            

        

            

                1802
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1803
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1804
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1805
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1806
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicPtr, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1807
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1808
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let ptr = &mut 5;

            

        

            

                1809
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let some_ptr = AtomicPtr::new(ptr);

            

        

            

                1810
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1811
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let other_ptr = &mut 10;

            

        

            

                1812
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1813
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let value = some_ptr.compare_and_swap(ptr, other_ptr, Ordering::Relaxed);

            

        

            

                1814
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1815
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1816
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "rust1", since = "1.0.0")]

            

        

            

                1817
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[deprecated(

            

        

            

                1818
            

            

                
            

            

                
        since = "1.50.0",

            

        

            

                1819
            

            

                
            

            

                
        note = "Use `compare_exchange` or `compare_exchange_weak` instead"

            

        

            

                1820
            

            

                
            

            

                
    )]

            

        

            

                1821
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg(target_has_atomic = "ptr")]

            

        

            

                1822
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg_attr(miri, track_caller)] // even without panics, this helps for Miri backtraces

            

        

            

                1823
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn compare_and_swap(&self, current: *mut T, new: *mut T, order: Ordering) -> *mut T {

            

        

            

                1824
            

            

                
            

            

                
        match self.compare_exchange(current, new, order, strongest_failure_ordering(order)) {

            

        

            

                1825
            

            

                
            

            

                
            Ok(x) => x,

            

        

            

                1826
            

            

                
            

            

                
            Err(x) => x,

            

        

            

                1827
            

            

                
            

            

                
        }

            

        

            

                1828
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1829
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1830
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Stores a value into the pointer if the current value is the same as the `current` value.

            

        

            

                1831
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1832
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// The return value is a result indicating whether the new value was written and containing

            

        

            

                1833
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// the previous value. On success this value is guaranteed to be equal to `current`.

            

        

            

                1834
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1835
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `compare_exchange` takes two [`Ordering`] arguments to describe the memory

            

        

            

                1836
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ordering of this operation. `success` describes the required ordering for the

            

        

            

                1837
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// read-modify-write operation that takes place if the comparison with `current` succeeds.

            

        

            

                1838
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `failure` describes the required ordering for the load operation that takes place when

            

        

            

                1839
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// the comparison fails. Using [`Acquire`] as success ordering makes the store part

            

        

            

                1840
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// of this operation [`Relaxed`], and using [`Release`] makes the successful load

            

        

            

                1841
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [`Relaxed`]. The failure ordering can only be [`SeqCst`], [`Acquire`] or [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1842
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1843
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// **Note:** This method is only available on platforms that support atomic

            

        

            

                1844
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// operations on pointers.

            

        

            

                1845
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1846
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1847
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1848
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1849
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicPtr, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1850
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1851
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let ptr = &mut 5;

            

        

            

                1852
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let some_ptr = AtomicPtr::new(ptr);

            

        

            

                1853
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1854
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let other_ptr = &mut 10;

            

        

            

                1855
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1856
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let value = some_ptr.compare_exchange(ptr, other_ptr,

            

        

            

                1857
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///                                       Ordering::SeqCst, Ordering::Relaxed);

            

        

            

                1858
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1859
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1860
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[stable(feature = "extended_compare_and_swap", since = "1.10.0")]

            

        

            

                1861
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg(target_has_atomic = "ptr")]

            

        

            

                1862
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[cfg_attr(miri, track_caller)] // even without panics, this helps for Miri backtraces

            

        

            

                1863
            

            

                
            

            

                
    pub fn compare_exchange(

            

        

            

                1864
            

            

                
            

            

                
        &self,

            

        

            

                1865
            

            

                
            

            

                
        current: *mut T,

            

        

            

                1866
            

            

                
            

            

                
        new: *mut T,

            

        

            

                1867
            

            

                
            

            

                
        success: Ordering,

            

        

            

                1868
            

            

                
            

            

                
        failure: Ordering,

            

        

            

                1869
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ) -> Result<*mut T, *mut T> {

            

        

            

                1870
            

            

                
            

            

                
        // SAFETY: data races are prevented by atomic intrinsics.

            

        

            

                1871
            

            

                
            

            

                
        unsafe { atomic_compare_exchange(self.p.get(), current, new, success, failure) }

            

        

            

                1872
            

            

                
            

            

                
    }

            

        

            

                1873
            

            

                
            

            

                

            

        

            

                1874
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Stores a value into the pointer if the current value is the same as the `current` value.

            

        

            

                1875
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1876
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// Unlike [`AtomicPtr::compare_exchange`], this function is allowed to spuriously fail even when the

            

        

            

                1877
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// comparison succeeds, which can result in more efficient code on some platforms. The

            

        

            

                1878
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// return value is a result indicating whether the new value was written and containing the

            

        

            

                1879
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// previous value.

            

        

            

                1880
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1881
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `compare_exchange_weak` takes two [`Ordering`] arguments to describe the memory

            

        

            

                1882
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ordering of this operation. `success` describes the required ordering for the

            

        

            

                1883
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// read-modify-write operation that takes place if the comparison with `current` succeeds.

            

        

            

                1884
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// `failure` describes the required ordering for the load operation that takes place when

            

        

            

                1885
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// the comparison fails. Using [`Acquire`] as success ordering makes the store part

            

        

            

                1886
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// of this operation [`Relaxed`], and using [`Release`] makes the successful load

            

        

            

                1887
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// [`Relaxed`]. The failure ordering can only be [`SeqCst`], [`Acquire`] or [`Relaxed`].

            

        

            

                1888
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1889
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// **Note:** This method is only available on platforms that support atomic

            

        

            

                1890
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// operations on pointers.

            

        

            

                1891
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1892
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// # Examples

            

        

            

                1893
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1894
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1895
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicPtr, Ordering};

            

        

            

                1896
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1897
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let some_ptr = AtomicPtr::new(&mut 5);

            

        

            

                1898
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///

            

        

            

                1899
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let new = &mut 10;

            

        

            

                1900
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// let mut old = some_ptr.load(Ordering::Relaxed);

            

        

            

                1901
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// loop {

            

        

            

                1902
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     match some_ptr.compare_exchange_weak(old, new, Ordering::SeqCst, Ordering::Relaxed) {

            

        

            

                1903
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///         Ok(_) => break,

            

        

            

                1904
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///         Err(x) => old = x,

            

        

            

                1905
            

            

                
            

            

                
    ///     }

            

        

            

                1906
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// }

            

        

            

                1907
            

            

                
            

            

                
    /// ```

            

        

            

                1908
            

            

                
            

            

                
    #[inline]

            

        

            

                1909
